Package bauernhof.preset

Class ArgumentParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • bauernhof.preset.Settings
      • bauernhof.preset.ArgumentParser
  • public class ArgumentParser
extends Settings
    Parse arguments from the command line and store them as settings.
    See Also:
    Settings

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArgumentParser

        public ArgumentParser​(String[] args,
                      String projectName,
                      String projectVersion,
                      List<String> projectAuthors,
                      List<OptionalFeature> implementedOptionalFeatures)
        Create a new ArgumentParser instance and parse the given arguments immediately.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments given by main(String[] args)
        projectName - the name of your project
        projectVersion - the version of your project
        projectAuthors - the authors of your project
        implementedOptionalFeatures - the optional features you have implemented (value can also be null, if no optional feature is implemented)

      • ArgumentParser

        public ArgumentParser​(String[] args,
                      String projectName,
                      String projectVersion,
                      List<String> projectAuthors,
                      List<OptionalFeature> implementedOptionalFeatures,
                      boolean parseImmediately)
        Create a new ArgumentParser instance.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments given by main(String[] args)
        projectName - the name of your project
        projectVersion - the version of your project
        projectAuthors - the authors of your project
        implementedOptionalFeatures - the optional features you have implemented (value can also be null, if no optional feature is implemented)
        parseImmediately - whether parse() should be called immediately

      • getJavaCommandLine

        public String getJavaCommandLine()
        Get the "java command line" used for starting the program without arguments.

        This might return something like "java -jar <YOUR-JAR-FILE>".

        Returns:
        the java command line without arguments
        See Also:
        overwriteJavaCommandLine(java.lang.String)
